intro: Lasiodiscus contumax, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which are usually violet or purple in color, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
